query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Poscia che l’accoglienze oneste e liete 2 furo iterate tre e quattro volte, 3 Sordel si trasse, e disse: «Voi, chi siete?».
query.result:
**English:**
1 After the courteous and joyful greetings 2 had been repeated three and four times, 3 Sordello stepped forward and said: "Who are you?".
**Sanskrit:**
1 Tataḥ satkāraḥ prītijananaśca 2 tṛṇi catvāri vāram abhyasyamānaḥ, 3 Sordellaḥ samīpamagamya uvāca: "Bhavān kaḥ?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 «Anzi che a questo monte fosser volte 5 l’anime degne di salire a Dio, 6 fur l’ossa mie per Ottavian sepolte.
query.result:
**English:**
4 If only the souls worthy of ascending to God 5 had turned to this mountain, 6 my bones would have been buried by Octavian.
**Sanskrit:**
4 Api cet asmin parvate vartante 5 ātmānaḥ śubhāḥ svargam āroḍhitum arhāḥ, 6 mama asthīni aṣṭāvianena samskṛtāni bhaveyuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Io son Virgilio; e per null’ altro rio 8 lo ciel perdei che per non aver fé». 9 Così rispuose allora il duca mio.
query.result:
**English:**
7 I am Virgil; and through no other fault 8 did I lose heaven than through not having faith." 9 Thus replied then my leader.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Aham asmi Virgiliyaḥ; na ca anyasmāt pāpāt 8 svargam nāśitam mayā yataḥ na asti śraddhā." 9 Evam uvāca tadā netā mama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Qual è colui che cosa innanzi sé 11 sùbita vede ond’ e’ si maraviglia, 12 che crede e non, dicendo «Ella è . . . non è . . . »,
13 tal parve quelli; e poi chinò le ciglia, 14 e umilmente ritornò ver’ lui, 15 e abbracciòl là ’ve ’l minor s’appiglia.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Like one who, seeing something ahead of him, 11 suddenly wonders what it is, 12 and believes and does not, saying, "It is . . . it is not . . . ",
13 so he appeared; and then he lowered his brows, 14 and humbly returned toward him, 15 and embraced him where the lesser one clings.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Yathā saḥ yaḥ kaścidartham agre 11 Āścaryāt sahasā paśyati, 12 Yaḥ śraddadhāti ca na ca, vadan, "Asti . . . nāsti . . . ",
13 Tathā saḥ adṛśyata; tataś ca bhruvau namrasya, 14 Namratayā ca punar ājagāma tasya abhimukham, 15 Umarṣa ca tam tatra yatra alpaḥ āśrayate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 «O gloria di Latin», disse, «per cui 17 mostrò ciò che potea la lingua nostra, 18 o pregio etterno del loco ond’ io fui,
19 qual merito o qual grazia mi ti mostra? 20 S’io son d’udir le tue parole degno, 21 dimmi se vien d’inferno, e di qual chiostra».
query.result:
**English:**
16 "O glory of the Latin tongue," he said, "through whom 17 our language showed its power, 18 O eternal honor of the place from which I come,
19 what merit or what grace shows you to me? 20 If I am worthy to hear your words, 21 tell me if you come from hell, and from what circle."
**Sanskrit:**
16 "He Latinaḥ śrīḥ," uvāca saḥ, "yena 17 prakāśitam yad abhūt śaktir asmākam vācaḥ, 18 yasya deśasya śāśvataṃ mahimā yataḥ aham āgam,
19 kaḥ puṇyaḥ kaḥ vā anugrahaḥ darśayati mām tava? 20 Yadi aham śravaṇe tava vacanānāṃ pātraṃ, 21 bruhi kim narakāt āgataḥ asi, katamāt kārāgārāt vā."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 «Per tutt’ i cerchi del dolente regno», 23 rispuose lui, «son io di qua venuto; 24 virtù del ciel mi mosse, e con lei vegno.
query.result:
**English:**
22 "Through all the circles of the realm of woe," 23 he answered me, "I have come from there; 24 the power of heaven moved me, and with it I come.
**Sanskrit:**
22 "Sarveṣu doṣapūrṇarājyasya maṇḍaleṣu," 23 sa aha uktvā, "ata eva āgato 'smi; 24 svargasya śaktir mām pravṛttāvan, tasyāḥ saha āgacchāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Non per far, ma per non fare ho perduto 26 a veder l’alto Sol che tu disiri 27 e che fu tardi per me conosciuto.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Not for doing, but for not doing have I lost 26 the sight of the high Sun which you desire 27 and which was recognized by me too late.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Na kartavyamiti, kimtutarna kartavyamiti 26 Uccaiḥ sūryam draṣṭum yam icchasi 27 Yaśca mayā viśeṣeṇa vijñātaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Luogo è là giù non tristo di martìri, 29 ma di tenebre solo, ove i lamenti 30 non suonan come guai, ma son sospiri.
query.result:
**English:**
28 There is a place down there, not sad with martyrs, 29 but of darkness alone, where the lamentations 30 do not sound like wails, but are sighs.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Adhaḥ sthānaṃ na duḥkhitaṃ martyaiḥ, 29 Andhakāra eva tatra, yatra vilāpāḥ 30 Na rodanavat śrūyante, kim tu viṣādāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Ma se tu sai e puoi, alcuno indizio 38 dà noi per che venir possiam più tosto 39 là dove purgatorio ha dritto inizio».
query.result:
**English:**
37 But if you know and are able, give us some indication 38 by which we can proceed more quickly 39 to where Purgatory rightly begins.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Api tu vetsi ca śaknoṣi ca, tadā kevalam ekaṃ sūcanam 38 asmābhiḥ prayacchatāṃ yena śīghram āgacchāmaḥ 39 tatra yatra śuddhikāraṇasya prārambhaḥ yuktaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Ma vedi già come dichina il giorno, 44 e andar sù di notte non si puote; 45 però è buon pensar di bel soggiorno.
query.result:
**English:**
43 But see how the day declines, 44 and it is not possible to travel at night; 45 therefore it is wise to think of a good resting place.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Api tu adya paśya yathā apakṣīyate divasaḥ, 44 rātrau ca gamanam na śakyate kartum; 45 atas tasmāt śubhasya viśrāmasthānasya cintayanam uttamam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Anime sono a destra qua remote; 47 se mi consenti, io ti merrò ad esse, 48 e non sanza diletto ti fier note».
query.result:
**English:**
46 Souls are here on the right hand, far removed; 47 if you consent, I will lead you to them, 48 and they will not be unpleasing to you.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Dakṣiṇe diśi prāṇinaḥ santi dūre sthitāḥ; 47 Yadi tvam anumatiṣe, aham tvām tatra naiṣyati, 48 Na ca te aprītikarāḥ bhavanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 «Com’ è ciò?», fu risposto. «Chi volesse 50 salir di notte, fora elli impedito 51 d’altrui, o non sarria ché non potesse?».
query.result:
**English:**
49 "How is that?" was the answer. "Who would wish 50 to climb at night, would be hindered 51 by others, or would not dare because he could not?"
**Sanskrit:**
49 "Katham idam?" iti pratyuttaram āsīt. "Yaḥ kaścid api 50 rātrau āroḍhum icchati, sa anyena pratibaddhaḥ syāt 51 vā na śaknoti iti na śaknoti?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 E ’l buon Sordello in terra fregò ’l dito, 53 dicendo: «Vedi? sola questa riga 54 non varcheresti dopo ’l sol partito:
55 non però ch’altra cosa desse briga, 56 che la notturna tenebra, ad ir suso; 57 quella col nonpoder la voglia intriga.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And the good Sordello traced a line on the ground with his finger, 53 saying: "See? You would not cross this line alone 54 after the sun has set,
55 not because anything else would hinder you, 56 except the darkness of the night, from going up; 57 that, with its powerlessness, entangles the will.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Tataś ca śubhaḥ Sordello bhumāv anguliṃ nimajjayām āsa, 53 uktavān: "Paśya? Ekākinīm etām rekḥām 54 na tarisyasi sūryasya gate sati:
55 Na tu anyad api kiñcid virodham janayet, 56 Yathā rātriḥ andhakāraḥ, ūrdhvam gantum; 57 Saivāśaktitvāt kāmaṃ badhnāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Ben si poria con lei tornare in giuso 59 e passeggiar la costa intorno errando, 60 mentre che l’orizzonte il dì tien chiuso».
query.result:
**English:**
58 One could indeed return below with her 59 and wander, straying along the shore, 60 while the horizon holds the day enclosed.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Tasyāḥ saha adhastāt punar āgacchitum śakyate eva 59 tataś ca digantam paribhramaṇam kṛtvā viharitum śakyate, 60 yāvad dinakaro digantam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Allora il mio segnor, quasi ammirando, 62 «Menane», disse, «dunque là ’ve dici 63 ch’aver si può diletto dimorando».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then my lord, as if wondering, 62 said, "Lead me then, where you say 63 that one can have delightful dwelling."
**Sanskrit:**
61 Tatra mama svāmī yathā viśmayam āpannaḥ, 62 "Naya", uvāca, "tatraiva yatra tvam vadasi 63 yatra sukham sthānam asti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Poco allungati c’eravam di lici, 65 quand’ io m’accorsi che ’l monte era scemo, 66 a guisa che i vallon li sceman quici.
query.result:
**English:**
64 We had proceeded but a short distance along the shore, 65 when I noticed that the mountain was cut off, 66 just as the valleys here are cut off.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Alpameva prayātaḥ āsam adhi pathi, 65 yadā aham ajānāṃ cakāra yathā parvataḥ khinnaḥ āsīt, 66 yathā atra api upatyakāni khinnāni bhavanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 «Colà», disse quell’ ombra, «n’anderemo 68 dove la costa face di sé grembo; 69 e là il novo giorno attenderemo».
query.result:
**English:**
67 "Over there," said that shade, "we will go 68 where the coast makes a lap of itself; 69 and there we will await the new day."
**Sanskrit:**
67 "Tatra," āha sā chāyā, "gacchāvahai 68 yatra tīraḥ ātmānaḥ āṅkam karoti; 69 tatra ca navaṃ dinaṃ pratipālayāvahai."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Tra erto e piano era un sentiero schembo, 71 che ne condusse in fianco de la lacca, 72 là dove più ch’a mezzo muore il lembo.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Between the plain and the steep slope was a winding path, 71 which led us to the edge of the abyss, 72 where the hillside ends more than halfway down.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Tato bhūmeḥ samatalaṃ madhye parvataśca viṣamaḥ, mārgaḥ ekaḥ āvṛttaḥ āsīt, 71 sa naḥ lacchāyāḥ pārśve nayati sma, 72 tatra adhaḥ ardha-bhāgād api adhika-bhāge parvatasya antaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Oro e argento fine, cocco e biacca, 74 indaco, legno lucido e sereno, 75 fresco smeraldo in l’ora che si fiacca,
76 da l’erba e da li fior, dentr’ a quel seno 77 posti, ciascun saria di color vinto, 78 come dal suo maggiore è vinto il meno.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Gold and fine silver, cochineal and white lead, 74 indigo, bright and clear wood, 75 fresh emerald at the hour when it breaks,
76 placed by the grass and flowers within that bosom, 77 each would be vanquished in color, 78 as the lesser is vanquished by its greater.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Suvarṇam rajatam śreṣṭham, raktam śuklam ca, 74 nīlam, kāṣṭham prabhāsvaram nirmalam ca, 75 navaḥ smaragdaḥ samaye yasmin bhidyate,
76 tṛṇaiḥ puṣpaiś ca, tasmin urasthalāt, 77 sthāpitāni, sarvāṇy eva varṇena jeyāni bhavanti, 78 yathā svāt paramaparāt jeyam bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Non avea pur natura ivi dipinto, 80 ma di soavità di mille odori 81 vi facea uno incognito e indistinto.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Nature alone had not painted there, 80 but with the sweetness of a thousand scents 81 she made there an unknown and indistinct [place].
**Sanskrit:**
79 Na kevalam prakṛtiḥ tatra citrāṃ cakāra, 80 api tu madhuryena sahasrāṇām gandhānām 81 tatra cakāra ekaṃ ajñātaṃ ca aviśiṣṭaṃ ca [sthānam].

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 ‘Salve, Regina’ in sul verde e ’n su’ fiori 83 quindi seder cantando anime vidi, 84 che per la valle non parean di fuori.
query.result:
**English:**
82 ‘Hail, Queen’ on the green grass and on the flowers 83 then I saw souls seated singing, 84 who did not seem to be outside for the valley.
**Sanskrit:**
82 ‘Namaḥ, Rājñī’ iti harite śaśini ca puṣpeṣu ca 83 tataḥ upaviśya gāyantaḥ ātmānaḥ apaśyam, 84 ye upatyakāyāḥ bahiḥ na adṛśyanta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 «Prima che ’l poco sole omai s’annidi», 86 cominciò ’l Mantoan che ci avea vòlti, 87 «tra color non vogliate ch’io vi guidi.
query.result:
**English:**
85 "Before the little sun sets," 86 began the Mantuan who had turned us, 87 "do not ask me to guide you among those."
**Sanskrit:**
85 "Alpaḥ sūryaḥ prāg evastaṃ yāti," 86 ārabhata Māntavaḥ yaḥ asmān āvartayām āsa, 87 "teṣāṃ madhye māṃ netāram mā icchatha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Di questo balzo meglio li atti e ’ volti 89 conoscerete voi di tutti quanti, 90 che ne la lama giù tra essi accolti.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Of this descent you will better know the acts and faces 89 of all of them, 90 who are gathered down there in the abyss.
**Sanskrit:**
88 Asya avalokanasya viśeṣataḥ karmaṇi ca mukhani ca 89 Jñāsyatha sarveṣhāṃ yathāvat, 90 Ye adhastāt tale nikṣiptāḥ santi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Colui che più siede alto e fa sembianti 92 d’aver negletto ciò che far dovea, 93 e che non move bocca a li altrui canti,
94 Rodolfo imperador fu, che potea 95 sanar le piaghe c’hanno Italia morta, 96 sì che tardi per altri si ricrea.
query.result:
**English:**
91 He who sits highest and makes a show 92 of having neglected what he should have done, 93 and who does not move his lips to others' songs,
94 was Emperor Rudolf, who could have healed 95 the wounds that have killed Italy, 96 so that she might be revived later by others.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Saḥ yaḥ uttama-sthāne sthitaḥ āste ca, kṛtvā 92 ābhāsam upekṣitasya yasya kartavyam āsīt, 93 yaś ca na calayati mukham anyeṣām gītebhyaḥ,
94 saḥ Rūḍālphaḥ āsīt samrāṭ, yaḥ śaknoti 95 nidānayaṃ kṛtvā mṛtāyāḥ Itāliyāyāḥ, 96 tasyāḥ kṣatajān vyādhitān ārogyāya kalpaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 L’altro che ne la vista lui conforta, 98 resse la terra dove l’acqua nasce 99 che Molta in Albia, e Albia in mar ne porta:
100 Ottacchero ebbe nome, e ne le fasce 101 fu meglio assai che Vincislao suo figlio 102 barbuto, cui lussuria e ozio pasce.
query.result:
**English:**
97 The other, who comforted him with his gaze, 98 ruled the land where the water is born 99 that the Elbe carries in abundance, and the Elbe carries to the sea:
100 His name was Ottokar, and in his swaddling clothes 101 he was far better than his son Wenceslas, 102 the bearded one, whom luxury and idleness feed.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Anyaḥ yaḥ tasya dṛṣṭau samāśvāsam ajījanat, 98 sa bhūmim āśiṣāsād yatra jalaḥ sambhavati, 99 yat Albyām bahulam pravahate, Albyā ca samudram praṇayati:
100 Asya nāma āsid Ottakaraḥ, jaṭhara-bandhane ca 101 sa Vincislāva-putreṇa svakīyena atiśayitaḥ āsīt, 102 śmaśruṇā yutaḥ, yaṃ viṣaya-sukha-ālasye ca poṣayataḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 E quel nasetto che stretto a consiglio 104 par con colui c’ha sì benigno aspetto, 105 morì fuggendo e disfiorando il giglio:
106 guardate là come si batte il petto! 107 L’altro vedete c’ha fatto a la guancia 108 de la sua palma, sospirando, letto.
query.result:
**English:**
103 And that little nose that, taking counsel with him 104 who has such a kind appearance, 105 died fleeing and disfiguring the lily:
106 look there how he beats his chest! 107 See the other who has made of his palm a bed 108 for his cheek, sighing.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Sa ca nāsikā yā mantram kṛtvā 104 tena saha yasya mukhaṃ svaprakāśam asti, 105 sa palāyantaḥ mṛtaḥ kumudam ca vikalayan:
106 paśyata tatra katham svayam uras tatāḍayati! 107 Aparamapi paśyata yaḥ svakarasparśena 108 svakapolasya śayyām kṛtvā niḥśvasati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Padre e suocero son del mal di Francia: 110 sanno la vita sua viziata e lorda, 111 e quindi viene il duol che sì li lancia.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Father and father-in-law are of the evil of France: 110 they know their life is flawed and filthy, 111 and hence comes the grief that so torments them.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Pitā ca śvaśuraśca Fraṃsadeśasya pāpakṛtau: 110 Jānītaḥ svayam eva jīvitaḥ svakīyaḥ kuṭilaḥ malamayaśca, 111 Ata eva jāyate śokaḥ yaḥ evam tāḍayati tau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Rade volte risurge per li rami 122 l’umana probitate; e questo vole 123 quei che la dà, perché da lui si chiami.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Rarely does human goodness rise again through the branches; and this he wills 122 who gives it, so that it may be called his.
**Sanskrit:**
121 Alpaḥ kālaḥ punarutpadyate mṛtyuloke manuṣyāṇāṃ śubhacaraṇam; etad eva ca 122 icchati sa yaḥ tad dadāti, yataḥ tena tad ātmanaḥ iti abhidhīyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Anche al nasuto vanno mie parole 125 non men ch’a l’altro, Pier, che con lui canta, 126 onde Puglia e Proenza già si dole.
query.result:
**English:**
124 My words apply to the snub-nosed one 125 no less than to the other, Pier, who sings with him, 126 because of whom Apulia and Provence grieve.
**Sanskrit:**
124 Naasikāyāmapi mama vacāṃsi gacchanti 125 Na kimcid alpam tat Pierād yasya saha gāyati, 126 Yasmāt nimittam Apuliā ca Pravāṃśca idānīm duḥkhite.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Tant’ è del seme suo minor la pianta, 128 quanto, più che Beatrice e Margherita, 129 Costanza di marito ancor si vanta.
query.result:
**English:**
127 So much is the plant inferior to its seed, 128 as, more than Beatrice and Margaret, 129 Constance still boasts of her husband.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Tāvān eva tasya bījamūlāt alpaḥ, 128 yathā, adhikaṃ Beatricāyāḥ ca Margaritāyāś ca, 129 Konstancā api svapatinā abhimānam karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Vedete il re de la semplice vita 131 seder là solo, Arrigo d’Inghilterra: 132 questi ha ne’ rami suoi migliore uscita.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Behold the king of the simple life, 131 sitting alone, Henry of England: 132 he has a better outcome in his branches.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Paśyata rājanam sarala-jīvanasya, 131 ekāki sthitaṃ, Harirājaṃ pratāpavān: 132 asya śākhāsu śreyān uttara-phalam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Quel che più basso tra costor s’atterra, 134 guardando in suso, è Guiglielmo marchese, 135 per cui e Alessandria e la sua guerra
136 fa pianger Monferrato e Canavese».
query.result:
**English:**
133 He who lies lowest of these, 134 looking up, is Marquis Guglielmo, 135 because of whom Alessandria and its war
136 make Monferrato and Canavese weep.
**Sanskrit:**
133 Eteṣāṃ yaḥ adhastāt sthitaḥ, 134 ūrdhvaṃ avalokayann asti Guiglielmo mārkiśaḥ, 135 yena Alessandria tasyāś ca yuddhaṃ
136 Monferratoṃ Caṇaveseṃ ca rodayati.
